headline.seo: Will the online exchanges work better this year than last?
headline.main: No More ‘Blue Screens of Death,’ Perhaps, but Exchanges Will Face New Challenges
headline.print_headline: Improvement Promised, but Exchanges Will Face Host of New Challenges

docs.abstract: Improvement in HealthCare.gov is promised as second enrollment period approaches for federal online health care marketplaces; government website essentially locked out most Americans in 2013.

docs.lead_paragraph: Open enrollment for health care begins on Nov. 15, but insurance companies will not yet have to provide consumers with key data required under the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Insurers’ Consumer Data Isn’t Ready for Enrollees
headline.print_headline: Insurers’ Consumer Data Isn’t Ready for Enrollees

docs.abstract: Obama administration says it will delay transparency requirements for health insurance companies to disclose data on number of people enrolled, number of claims denied and costs to consumers for specific services; consumer advocates express disappointment, saying such information would be helpful to millions of consumers shopping for insurance in open enrollment period beginning in November.
docs.snippet: Open enrollment for health care begins on Nov. 15, but insurance companies will not yet have to provide consumers with key data required under the Affordable Care Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: As insurers and providers fight over revenue in an era of cost control, patients often find themselves nickel-and-dimed between them.

headline.main: As Insurers Try to Limit Costs, Providers Hit Patients With More Separate Fees
headline.print_headline: As Insurers Try to Limit Costs, Providers Hit Patients With More Separate Fees

docs.abstract: Health insurers are lowering payments to physicians and hospitals, prompting providers to hit back with a host of new charges that come as shock to many patients.
docs.snippet: As insurers and providers fight over revenue in an era of cost control, patients often find themselves nickel-and-dimed between them.

docs.lead_paragraph: The notion that today’s lower deficit must represent economic progress does not withstand scrutiny.

headline.main: Deficit Talk in an Election Year
headline.print_headline: Deficit Talk in an Election Year

docs.abstract: Editorial asserts that shrinking federal deficit, while marginally good news, has come at costs that should make neither Republicans nor Democrats proud; points to squandered opportunities for investing in creating jobs, fostering healthier economy and nurturing future growth; warns that further cuts will fall disproportionately on Americans ill-equipped to shoulder the burden.
docs.snippet: The notion that today’s lower deficit must represent economic progress does not withstand scrutiny.
